intro: Nepeta cataria var. citriodora, commonly known as lemon balm, is a perennial herb native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It features fragrant, small, white or pale blue flowers and serrated, ovate leaves that emit a citrus-like aroma. The plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, often growing in moist environments. Its essential oils, rich in citral and other compounds, contribute to its calming effects and medicinal uses. This variety is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes and in aromatherapy.
